text: this is the moment the earthquake struck
you can hear the terror of those in this
building the result was huge damage in
the densely populated kathmandu valley
in the pool
leaving rescuers digging desperately
with their hands the earthquake sent
thousands of people fleeing for relative
safety away from damaged buildings the
injured were treated outside hospitals
which have been inundated with
casualties earthquakes of this high 7.9
magnitude are rare this is the worst to
hit this Himalayan nation in over 80
years so far more than a hundred
fatalities have been reported but
observers on the ground say that figure
is likely to rise significantly in other
cities have come out on the ground in
the open field in large masses I do not
know how many people have suffered
injuries but we're trying to get me
first information from various several
buildings collapsed in the center of the
capital the ancient old Kathmandu
including this that there are a tower it
was reduced to a stump and there are
reports of people trapped underneath
these extraordinary pictures have
emerged - of what looks like a statue
being recovered but this is a man buried
alive and pulled to safety many others
haven't been so lucky on Everest
climbers were sent running for their
lives from base camp as the quake
shipped them from their tents and
triggered avalanches at this time of
year many climbers are on the mountain
experts say the earthquake was
geologically very shallow meaning
greater damage Danny savage BBC news
